Module com.example.battleship
Package com.example.battleship.Model.Player

Interface IPlayer

All Known Implementing Classes:
Human, Machine, PlayerAdapter
public interface IPlayer
Player interface used by Human and Machine implementations. A player is responsible for tracking its own shots and elimination state.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    alreadyShot(int x, int y)
    Check whether this player has already shot at a specific coordinate.
    String
    getName()
    Returns the player's display name.
    List<int[]>
    getShots()
    Returns the list of shots this player has made.
    boolean
    isEliminated()
    Returns whether the player has been eliminated from the game.
    void
    shoot(int positionX, int positionY)
    Register a shot made by this player.

  • Method Details

    • shoot

      void shoot(int positionX, int positionY)
      Register a shot made by this player.
      Parameters:
      positionX - 1-based column (x) coordinate of the shot
      positionY - 1-based row (y) coordinate of the shot

    • alreadyShot

      boolean alreadyShot(int x, int y)
      Check whether this player has already shot at a specific coordinate.
      Parameters:
      x - 1-based column coordinate
      y - 1-based row coordinate
      Returns:
      true if the player previously fired at (x, y)

    • isEliminated

      boolean isEliminated()
      Returns whether the player has been eliminated from the game.
      Returns:
      true when eliminated

    • getName

      String getName()
      Returns the player's display name.
      Returns:
      name of the player

    • getShots

      List<int[]> getShots()
      Returns the list of shots this player has made. Each shot is represented as an int[] of length 2: {x, y}.
      Returns:
      mutable list of shot coordinates
